abstract: At an industry conference, the most concrete sign of progress is an announcement that Deepwater Wind will buy five six-megawatt turbines from Siemens for a $205 million wind farm near Block Island.
snippet: At an industry conference, the most concrete sign of progress is an announcement that Deepwater Wind will buy five six-megawatt turbines from Siemens for a $205 million wind farm near Block Island.
lead_paragraph: These may be uncertain times for renewable energy, with the collapse of Solyndra and a persistently low price for natural gas, a competitor, but the talk is upbeat at the American Wind Energy Association's annual offshore wind conference, in Baltimore.

headline.main: Offshore Wind Is a Bit Closer, Backers Say
